title: First metal part 3D printed in space
summary: ESA’s Metal 3D Printer has produced the first metal part ever created in space.

title: Earth from Space: Sentinel-2 captures Sentinel-2
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2B satellite captured this image over Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana on 2 September, just ahead of the Sentinel-2C launch.

title: China’s secretive reusable spaceplane lands after 267 days in orbit
summary: HELSINKI — China’s experimental reusable spaceplane returned to Earth late Thursday, completing its third orbital mission. State media Xinhua issued a brief report on Sept. 5 (Eastern), confirming the spacecraft’s […]

title: Persevering Through the Storm
summary: It’s dust-storm season on Mars! Over the past couple of weeks, as we ascended the Jezero Crater rim, our science team has monitored increasing dust in the atmosphere — typically highest around this time of the Martian year.

title: Blue Origin racing to meet tight launch window for first New Glenn mission
summary: While preparations for the first launch of Blue Origin’s New Shepard rocket are accelerating, the company acknowledges there is “lots to do” to get the vehicle ready to meet a narrow launch window next month.

title: SpaceX launches Falcon 9 rocket on national security mission for the NRO
summary: The flight will set a new record for orbital launches from Vandenberg Space Force Base. Liftoff of the NROL-113 mission happened at 8:20 p.m. PDT (11:20 p.m. EDT, 0320 UTC).

title: Aerospacelab opens doors to first US satellite manufacturing facility
summary: European small satellite maker Aerospacelab announced the opening of its first manufacturing facility in the United States Sept. 5 amid efforts to break into the lucrative U.S. government market.

title: KBR’s latest acquisition boosts its classified space workforce amid growing military demand
summary: The company just completed a $737 million of the defense and space support services contractor LinQuest

title: Sols 4295-4296: A Martian Moon and Planet Earth
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, Sept. 4, 2024 Today’s two-sol plan contains the usual science blocks filled with contact science and remote science to observe and assess the geology surrounding us. However, the Mastcam team is hoping to capture a special celestial event above the Martian skyline as one of Mars’ moons, Phobos, will be in […]

title: NASA Selects Langley Research Center Support Contractor
summary: NASA has awarded the Center, Operations Maintenance, and Engineering II contract to Jacobs Technology Inc. of Tullahoma, Tennessee, to support operations at the agency’s Langley Research Center in Hampton, Virginia. The contract is a cost-plus-fixed-fee indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum potential value of $973.7 million. Following a phase-in period that starts Tuesday, Oct. 1 and […]
